intro: Brassica cheiranthos var. gredensis, commonly known as the Gredens rockcress, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial that typically reaches heights of 10–30 cm, with basal leaves that are linear to oblanceolate in shape. The plant produces small, bright yellow flowers arranged in racemes, which bloom in late spring to early summer. It is native to the mountainous regions of the Iberian Peninsula and is adapted to rocky and well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
